column2: NY DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: New York
column6: NY

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must go to the next intersection.
column6: must turn into its right lane.
column10: must turn into its left lane.

column2: 2. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.
column6: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.

column2: 3. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Pull the steering wheel back.
column6: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column10: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 4. A flashing yellow 'X' light above the pavement means:
column4: This lane can only be used for a left turn.
column6: You can use this lane only if you need to turn right.
column8: This is a reversed lane. Drive with caution.

column2: 5. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column4: Always.
column6: If traffic conditions require it.
column10: Before you decrease speed and reach the intersection.

column2: 6. Seat belt use is not required:
column4: in taxis.
column6: by passengers in buses (except school buses).

column2: 7. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: You.
column6: No one.

column2: 8. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column6: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column8: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.

column2: 9. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column4: green, red and yellow
column6: red, green and yellow

column2: 10. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column4: Yield.
column6: Turn off the ignition.

column2: 11. This sign means:
column4: 270 degree turn ahead.
column6: Wrong way; Turn around immediately.

column2: 12. To improve their visibility, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: quickly change speed or lane position.
column6: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.

column2: 13. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column6: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.
column8: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column10: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.

column2: 14. Bicyclists must:
column4: keep at least one hand on the handlebars at all times.
column6: signal turns and stops through the use of hand signals.
column8: never carry an infant under a year old as a passenger.

column2: 15. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: try your emergency lights.
column6: get off the road and check your tires.
column8: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 16. BAC is expressed in:
column4: percentage of alcohol to blood.
column6: percentage of blood to alcohol.
column10: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 17. A three-point turn is used:
column4: to turn your car around in a small space.
column6: whenever possible, to change lane.
column8: on a curve, when a sign indicates that making a U-turn is prohibited.
column10: to indicate your intention to turn.

column2: 18. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column6: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.
column8: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 19. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the speed limit on that route.
column6: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.
column8: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
column10: the type of route you are on.

column2: 20. Where are pennant signs placed?
column4: On the right side of the road, facing the driver.
column6: On windy roads.
column8: On the left side of the road, facing the driver.
column10: Where a highway is divided into two one-way roadways.
